posts.title: That Boy Is a Monster: Monster Mayhem Manga
posts.text: Follow the journey of these manga "monsters" as they learn how to tame the beasts within them before they themselves succumb to the overwhelming rage and power!

posts.title: Staff-Recommended Manga Reads for Fall
posts.text: Put your favorite cozy sweater on and cuddle up with some of our latest round of manga staff picks.

posts.title: Reader Beware, You're In For a Scare: Horror Graphic Novel Staff Picks
posts.text: Our devoted team of eerie experts are standing by to give you titles that will leave you trembling in terror.

posts.title: Chills, Thrills, & Super Bloody Spills: Horror Manga for the Masses
posts.text: Greetings ghouls! Are you a fan of things that go bump in the night? Do you delight in tales of death and despair? Are you, like, really into zombies? Then you’re in the right place!

posts.title: Let's Get Meta: Manga About Manga!
posts.text: Here we’ve gathered titles that feature either the effort that goes into creating manga, selling manga, or just being obsessed with manga.

posts.title: It's About to Get Weird: Surreal Manga and Graphic Novels
posts.text: Our librarians have scoured our collection to bring you some of the trippiest, dreamiest, weirdest surreal manga and graphic novels.

posts.title: Take a Walk On the Mild Side with Slice of Life Fantasy Manga
posts.text: If you’re ready to help a dragon find a home or to explore the realities of dungeon cuisine, then you’re ready for this fun manga subgenre.

posts.title: High School Never Ends: School Life Manga
posts.text: As these titles show, the turbulent teenage years are prime fodder for stories that explore burgeoning feelings of love, anger, resentment, and self-actualization.

posts.title: Staff-Recommended Manga Reads for Summer
posts.text: Ready to kick back on the beach with a new book? Here is a list of our librarians' personal favorite must-read manga.

posts.title: Stop and Smell the Roses with Slice of Life Manga
posts.text: Sometimes you need a break from the overpowered foes and never-ending tournaments of battle manga. If you're looking for a calmer read, slice of life manga are what you need.

posts.title: Craft With Me: Crochet Picture Book Inspiration
posts.text: Crochet is a great medium for showing off your personality through your creations. If your little one has a favorite character, why not bring them to life yourself? Our craft section is full of great pattern books that are easily adaptable.

posts.title: So Many Loves, So Little Time: Harem Manga
posts.text: These stories revolve around the protagonist struggling to choose which of the possible romantic partners they want to end up with. The series will end up in one of two ways: 1. They make a decision and end up with one person, or 2. They choose none of them.

posts.title: Beauties and Beasts: Monster Manga
posts.text: While typically romantic in nature, manga in this genre focus on the relationships between humans and monsters or monsters and other monsters regardless of whether they are platonic, romantic, or sexual. Here monster refers to any non-human creature such as a vampire, demon, mermaid, unicorn—anything really!

posts.title: Battle Manga! All-Out Fight to the Finish!
posts.text: Greetings fighters! Are you ready to power up and battle down? Then drop your training weights, and let’s dive into some battle manga!

posts.title: Beginner's Guide to Manga 2: Genres and Subgenres
posts.text: Here we have gathered some of the most popular and unique genres, subgenres, and tropes that currently exist in manga to better help you find your next read!

posts.title: Jump on the Bandwagon: New and Ongoing Manga To Get Excited About
posts.text: Some of these series have been going on for years with no end in sight while others are relatively new. If you’re looking for something new or new-ish to check out, you’re in the right place.

posts.title: A Feast for Fans: Manga of Epic Proportions
posts.text: These behemoths of twenty-five volumes or more are perfect for veteran readers who can handle long, multi-volume story arcs, and slow but steady character growth.

posts.title: Manga for Days: Manga 25 Volumes or Fewer for Adults
posts.text: Love manga, but aren't looking for a long-term commitment? These series have enough volumes to really develop character and plot, but won't make you feel totally overwhelmed.

posts.title: Art and War: World War II Graphic Novels
posts.text: Art Spiegelman’s Maus brought attention to the validity of graphic novels as a storytelling format. In the decades since, others have come forward with their own stories of survival or their own understanding of events told through graphic novels that allow them to not only write their own stories but also to control the visuals so that we can quite literally see events through their point of view.

posts.title: Manga for Days: Manga 25 Volumes or Fewer for Teens
posts.text: Love manga and want a nice juicy series to sink your teeth into, but don't want to get overwhelmed? We've got you!

posts.title: Craft With Me: Fun with Cardboard
posts.text: Looking for craft projects to try at home with kids? Here are two books with cardboard craft projects that we've tried out and reviewed for you along with some related books you can check out.

posts.title: Homemade Holiday: Greeting Cards
posts.text: Reconnect with your family the old fashioned way this holiday season by sending them a card. Cards are a great way to express your creativity because there really is no right or wrong way to decorate them. Card-making is also a great way to keep kids entertained during a winter afternoon.

posts.title: Homemade Holiday: Kids Learn to Crochet
posts.text: Crochet is a fun activity to do at home and easy enough for children to learn. Here are some suggested projects to pass time at home and to give to family and friends as homemade gifts.

posts.title: Blast from the Past: Historical Fiction Manga
posts.text: Travel to the past with these fantastic historical fiction manga!

posts.title: Women in Science: Pioneers of the Natural World
posts.text: For centuries, women in science haven't received their due credit for the work they've done to further our understanding of the natural world. These books, for kids of all ages, are perfect for inspiring future zoologists, primatologists, biologists...or any other -ologists!

posts.title: A Beginner's Guide to Classic Manga
posts.text: These must-read manga books have impacted the literary or pop culture landscapes in some major, long-lasting ways.

posts.title: Award-Winning Manga 3: Shonen Category
posts.text: What is Shōnen? In short, Shōnen manga are Japanese comic books aimed at a young male audience. If you are looking for stories about adventure, friendship, and action, then you’re in luck!

posts.title: The Finer Things Club: Biographies and Memoirs
Award-Winning Manga 2: Shojo Category
posts.text: Shōjo manga are Japanese comic books aimed at a young, female audience. Teenagers are typically the target demographic, but really these titles are accessible to anyone.

posts.title: Award-Winning Manga 1: General Category
posts.text: Trying to sift through the staggering amount of manga currently available can seem very daunting. Fortunately, a multitude of international committees have taken over the task for us.

posts.title: The Finer Things Club: Classic Literature by Authors of Color
posts.text: Why not take some time to reconnect with friends over a juicy novel and savory meal, even if you have to do it virtually?

posts.title: You've Got Mail: Old-Fashioned Letter Writing for Fun
posts.text: Delight someone at home with a real letter in their mailbox.

posts.title: Vintage Recipes For Modern Cooks
posts.text: There are always new fad-diets and foodstuffs that come and go, so it’s a good thing to have a tried and true list of recipes you and your family can fall back on

posts.title: Old Time Rock 'N' Roll: Rockabilly Reads
posts.text: Grab some pomade, fix your hair, and get ready to have a blast!

posts.title: Never-Ending Stories: High Fantasy Epic Sagas
posts.text: If you're looking for a lengthy fantasy series to really sink your teeth into, then find a comfy chair, pour yourself a hot mug of your favorite brew, and get ready to get lost in worlds unknown!

posts.title: Here Be Dragons: A Beginner's Guide to Fantasy
posts.text: The key difference between works of fantasy and works of any other genre can be summed up in one word: magic.

posts.title: Hallmarks of Fantasy: A Brief History of the Genre
posts.text: The history of fantasy is as old as humanity itself.

posts.title: Quick Reads: Manga Fewer than Ten Volumes
posts.text: New to manga? Don’t know where to start? Don’t worry—we’re here to help!

posts.title: A Look Back: The Most Loved Books of 2019 by Mid-Manhattan Librarians
posts.text: It's the time of year to look back and reflect on our favorite reads of 2019. Here's a roundup of the most loved books of the year from our Mid-Manhattan librarians.

posts.title: End of the World as We Know It: Apocalyptic, Post-Apocalyptic, and Dystopian Worlds
posts.text: Dystopian and apocalyptic fiction have been narrative mainstays since George Orwell's "1984" and Ray Bradbury's "Fahrenheit 451." If this captures your imagination, check out our recommendations!

posts.title: The Gift of Reading: Book Bundles
posts.text: Looking for new titles in your favorite subgenres? We've gathered a list of book bundles, from true crime to cozy mysteries to video game fiction.

posts.title: Nom-Nom November: Food and Cooking Manga
posts.text: Food is such an integral part of any society, so it's no wonder many stories revolve around food prep, design, and enjoyment. With our favorite food-related manga, you'll get all the drama, recipes, and limitless food possibilities. Douzo meshiagare!

posts.title: Frightful Fiction Roundup: Our 31 Days to Halloween Countdown
posts.text: 31 days in October... 31 of the spookiest, most unnerving books we know. We've compiled our ongoing series of scary social media recommendations into one frightfully fantastic list.

posts.title: Where to Start with Stephen King
posts.text: Stephen King has written more than 90 novels and 200 short stories, as one of the most prolific and popular authors in modern literature. If you're ready to delve into the work of the Master of Horror, we can help! Find recommendations on his story collections, most widely read titles, and 1,000-plus-page epics.

posts.title: That's What She Read: Reading Recommendations from "The Office"
posts.text: What books would the endearing (often exasperating) personalities of Dunder Mifflin be reading?

posts.title: Saddle Up For Fierce Female Westerns!
posts.text: Where are the western heroines who take after Annie Oakley or Stagecoach Mary? Well we've got them right here, with a list of our favorite western literature featuring female leads.

posts.title: Rebels, Renegades, and Radicals: Ladies of the West
posts.text: In the American western, men are typically lauded as heroes, or even anti-heroes, while women are often painted as either prostitutes or wholesome farm girls. In reality, women occupied much more varied roles in the Old West. Our nonfiction picks tell their stories.

posts.title: What Would the Golden Girls Read?
posts.text: Sarcastic Dorothy... filter-free Sophia... saucy Southern belle Blanche... lovable, exasperating Rose... This famed quartet of friends never came across an issue they couldn't solve together. But what book recommendations would each of these women share? Here's what we think.

posts.title: Get Your Head in the Game! Sports and Game-Based Manga Recommendations
posts.text: Whether it's sports, tabletop or videogames, we love games of all kinds. So, we've gathered a collection of our favorite game-based manga!

posts.title: A Beginner's Guide to Isekai
posts.text: Discover an entire genre of manga in which characters are suddenly transported to new, unfamiliar worlds. If you enjoy Miyazaki's Spirited Away, you'll enjoy this list of recommended manga, ready to get your interested in isekai started.

posts.title: A Beginner's Guide to LGBTQ+ Manga
posts.text: Although homosexuality in Japan has been frowned upon in modern society, this has not stopped queer writers and artists from producing work—and has not stopped readers from consuming it. In celebration of Pride Month, we're revisiting some of our favorite Japanese manga featuring LGBTQ+ characters and themes.

posts.title: A Beginner's Guide to Mecha
posts.text: Robots. Cyborgs. Androids. Space stations. They all make up the manga and anime genre known as mecha. Read about the history of mecha, and discover our comprehensive list of recommended manga, movies, and TV series.

posts.title: Manga Monday Picks: Shojo Beat Favorites
posts.text: Do you love high fantasy adventures featuring daring heroines and handsome heroes? Supernatural romances? Or maybe simple slice-of-life stories? No matter, Shojo Beat has them all, and we have a list of recommendations compiled by staff and patrons from our latest Manga Monday meet-up.

posts.title: A Brief History of the Romance Novel
posts.text: Whether you’re a long-time romance novel veteran or a tentative newbie, enjoy the genre's background, and our list of recommended titles that are sure to thrill your wildest fantasies!

posts.title: Hot, Steamy, and Extra Dreamy: Romance Manga
posts.text: Whether you prefer romantic comedies, supernatural love stories, or straight-up hot-and-steamy adventures, we've got the manga recommendation for you!

posts.title: Manga for Middle Schoolers: Guide and Recommendations
posts.text: Whether you're a parent, guardian, educator, or librarian, you might be at a loss when a middle grader asks for a manga recommendation. Fear not, we're here to help!

posts.title: Where to Start with Edgar Allan Poe
posts.text: Best known for his dark tales of horror, psychological terror, and madness, Poe’s own life was marked by both internal and external tragedies that undoubtedly shaped his work.

posts.title: Where to Start with Werewolves: Super Blood Wolf Moon Edition!
posts.text: With the upcoming Super Blood Wolf Moon, we’ve put together a list of recommendations based on, you guessed it, our favorite supernatural wolf-creature: the werewolf!

posts.title: Manga Monday Picks: Shonen Jump Classics
posts.text: If you didn't make it to our first Manga Monday meeting (the 1st Monday of each month), here are the fantastic manga recommendations from staff and patrons, including a unanimous must-read choice for every manga fan!

posts.title: A Beginner's Guide to Science Fiction
posts.text: Have you ever wanted to travel the galaxies, meet dinosaurs, or delve into the depths of the sea all without leaving your home? Then we’ve got the books for you!

posts.title: A Beginner's Guide to Manga
posts.text: Want to start reading manga? You've come to the right place. We've defined five major categories of this Japanese-based comic book art, and offer reading recommendations available in the NYPL catalog. Check it out!

posts.title: Where to Start with Shirley Jackson
posts.text: A master of Gothic mystery and horror, Shirley Jackson’s novels and short stories still resonate with readers.

posts.title: Hip, Hip, Hooray for National Princess Day! Picture Book Edition
posts.text: In the spirit of Frances Hodgson Burnett's classic, A Little Princess, and National Princess Day, check our list of recommended picture books for all young princesses-in-training!

posts.title: Hip, Hip, Hooray for National Princess Day! Chapter Book Edition
posts.text: Celebrate your own princesses-in-training on November 18, with our selection of books about kind, confident, brave, true young princesses!

posts.title: In Memory of Stan Lee: Books, Comic Books, and Movies
posts.text: As the world mourns the loss of this cultural icon and legend, we look back at the illustrious career and amazing superheroes of Stan Lee.

posts.title: 13 Days to Halloween Spooky Suggestions
posts.text: It's the perfect time for our eerie "lucky 13" recommendations, compiled from the Library's social media feeds. Get into the spirit! (Or "spirits", as the case may be...)

posts.title: A Brief History of Halloween
posts.text: From an ancient Celtic ritual to the massive cultural phenomenon it is today, Halloween has a history - and a list of history books - that's worth checking out.

posts.title: Dark and Beautiful: Young Adult Gothic Fiction
posts.text: If you're ready for tales of terror and romance, check out our 15 choices for top YA gothic fiction novels.

posts.title: Living Dangerously: 13 Haunted House Novels
posts.text: Nearly every neighborhood has a "haunted house," a structure that may not appear evil at first glance but has a sordid history (that may or may not be true) attached to it. A house is supposed to be a safe space, a shelter from evil—but what do you do when the evil comes from within? From classic haunted mansions to contemporary apartment complexes, we have gathered up 13 of the best haunted house stories to make you think twice before signing a mortgage!

posts.title: A Brief History of Gothic Horror
posts.text: For centuries, the subgenre of gothic horror has been spooking readers who love bleak, inescapable landscapes and the forces of evil at work. Check out our list of 15 gothic horror favorites...

posts.title: A Brief History of Gothic Romance
posts.text: If you like stories of independent women and dark brooding men, amid creepy castles and a gloomy atmosphere, you'll want to check out these 15 recommendations.

posts.title: Remembering Charles Addams: Children's Picture Book Edition
posts.text: The famed cartoonist may have loved our recommendations of spooky books for your littlest goblins.

posts.title: Remembering Charles Addams: Elementary & Middle School Edition
posts.text: Looking for something mysterious and spooky for kids? You've come to the right place...

posts.title: Romance Novel Month: Modern Love | 10 Contemporary Romance Novels
posts.text: In case you need advice on how to woo a potential partner or just want to imagine yourself in the arms of a dashing duke, our librarians have rounded up some of our favorite recommendations for romance novels!

posts.title: Think Ink! Happy National Tattoo Day
posts.text: Nearly every culture and race has some connection to tattooing, and we have a comprehensive list of our favorite book recommendations on the subject.

posts.title: Power Up For Pride With LGBTQ+ Superheroes!
posts.text: With LGBTQ+ representation in comic books and graphic novels seeing a definite rise in recent years, here are a dozen titles we recommend.

posts.title: Bela Lugosi's Dead, and Other Reasons to Celebrate World Goth Day
posts.text: Celebrate the subculture that showed the world how to find beauty in the dark with recommended books, music, and movies.

posts.title: Ssh! Seven Book Recommendations for Fans of "A Quiet Place"
posts.text: If your heart is still pounding from director-star John Krasinski's thriller, we have some reading suggestions for you.

posts.title: Como La Flor: 5 Ways to Celebrate the Life of Selena Quintanilla
posts.text: April 16 is known as Selena Day in the Texas hometown of the legendary Tejano performer. Find your own way to celebrate with movies, books and, of course, music.

posts.title: National Poetry Month: 5 New York-Based Novels Told In Verse
posts.text: To begin celebrating National Poetry Month, we look at a selection of novels told through narrative poetry - and set in New York.

posts.title: April Fools Special! Our Favorite Comedy Manga!
posts.text: If you like pranks, jokes, and hijinks in your reading and viewing, these manga and anime titles are just for you.

posts.title: Finding Your Own Four-Leaf Clover: Book Recommendations to Reach Your Dreams
posts.text: There's no need to rely on luck when you can make your own success! Here are seven book recommendations with teens in mind, to drive motivation and inspiration.

posts.title: Recommendations for Lunar New Year!
posts.text: Celebrate The Year of the Dog with eight recommendations highlighting fiction from Asian-American authors.

posts.title: 7 Gal Pal Lit Picks
posts.text: Grab your bestie and some tissues as you prepare to laugh, cry, and remember just what makes a bestie so wonderful!

posts.title: New Book Recommendations for Your 2018 New Year's Resolutions
posts.text: Keeping to your New Year's resolutions? Whether you resolved to make a fresh start, begin a new romance, or find yourself, these recommendations can help inspire you.

posts.title: Love: In the Air, On the Page
posts.text: With February comes Valentine's Day, and these 14 recommendations that celebrate love in all its forms.
